author: airmak
body:
I am trying to use a Bazel command on a folder, but for some reason PowerShell is denying me access to my folders. How can I grant access to modify these files?

```
PS C:\users\snmsa\desktop\github\lm_1b> bazel build -c opt lm_1b/...
..............................
ERROR: no such package 'external': Error encountered while dealing with the WORKSPACE file: C:\users\snmsa\desktop\github\lm_1b\WORKSPACE (Access is denied)
ERROR: no such package 'external': Error encountered while dealing with the WORKSPACE file: C:\users\snmsa\desktop\github\lm_1b\WORKSPACE (Access is denied)
INFO: Elapsed time: 19.916s
FAILED: Build did NOT complete successfully (0 packages loaded)
PS C:\users\snmsa\desktop\github\lm_1b>

```

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @airmak What PowerShell version you use? Do you test with latest PowerShell Core build?

title: PowerShell denying access to files
